intro: Galium chloranthum, commonly known as green-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium chloranthum is known for its delicate appearance and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
